title: Contributing to iSEEindex
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to iSEEindex
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("iSEE/iSEEindex", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to iSEEindex
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Adding a custom header and footer to the landing page
text: default, iSEEindex creates minimal landing page presenting users fluid row contains two shinydashboard::box(): left, users can select data set. right, users can select initial configuration launch main app interface. iSEEindex offers opportunity app maintainers add content (.e., header) (.e., footer) row. header footer space may contain valid UI element displayed application UI .

title: Adding a custom header and footer to the landing page
text: function iSEEindex() accepts header footer content arguments body.header= body.footer=. recommend wrapping header footer content shiny::fluidRow(), fit naturally main fluid row (see ).

title: Adding a custom header and footer to the landing page
text: First, let us set core elements simple application (see ?iSEEindex). , design header footer content, wrapped shiny::fluidRow(). image file found, containing directory must added Shiny resource path follows: Finally, supply custom header footer iSEEindex().
code: library("BiocFileCache")  ## # BiocFileCache ---- ##  library(BiocFileCache) bfc <- BiocFileCache(cache = tempdir())  ## # iSEEindex ---- ##  dataset_fun <- function() {   x <- yaml::read_yaml(system.file(package = "iSEEindex", "example.yaml"))   x$datasets }  initial_fun <- function() {   x <- yaml::read_yaml(system.file(package = "iSEEindex", "example.yaml"))   x$initial } library("shiny") header <- fluidRow(shinydashboard::box(width = 12L,    column(width = 10,     p(strong("Welcome to this demonstration app!")),     p(       "This is an example header that demonstrate how to use the functionality.",       "A great place for branding and intros.",     ),     p("On the right, we demonstrate how other content such as images can be added to this header.")   ),   column(width = 2, img(src="www/iSEE.png", width = "100px", height = "120px")) )) footer <- fluidRow(shinydashboard::box(width = 12L,   p("This is a example footer. A great place for copyright statements and outros.", style="text-align: center;"),   p(     "© 2023 iSEE.",     a("Artistic-2.0", href = "https://opensource.org/license/artistic-2-0/"),     style="text-align: center;")   )) library("shiny") addResourcePath("www", system.file(package = "iSEEindex")) library("iSEEindex") app <- iSEEindex(bfc, dataset_fun, initial_fun,   body.header = header, body.footer = footer )  if (interactive()) {   shiny::runApp(app, port = 1234) }

title: Introduction to iSEEindex
text: basic example shows launch application lists publicly available data sets hosted zenodo.org:  Let’s break example step step, illustrate functionality flexibility iSEEindex. First, load iSEEindex BiocFileCache packages, access functionality. Next, use BiocFileCache::BiocFileCache() function, create persistent -disk cache files app can use adding retrieving data files sessions. particularly useful example, demonstrate hosting data sets configuration scripts RDS files R scripts remotely, zenodo.org repository. Next, define function – example, named dataset_fun – returns list metadata available data sets. example, information parsed example file distributed inst/ directory package. However, users may define function fetches information way see fit, e.g. authenticating accessing data privately accessible sources. Requirements function detailed help page ?iSEEindex, argument FUN.datasets. Next, define another function – example, named initial_fun – returns list metadata available initial configurations application state, individual data set. example, information parsed example file distributed inst/ directory package. However, similarly previous function, users may define function fetches information way see fit. Requirements function detailed help page ?iSEEindex, argument FUN.initial. , pass BiocFileCache object two custom functions defined iSEEindex::iSEEindex() function, create iSEE application incorporates landing page offering users choice data sets initial configurations fetched custom functions. Finally, use shiny::runApp() function launch app.
code: library("iSEEindex") library("BiocFileCache")  bfc <- BiocFileCache(cache = tempdir())  dataset_fun <- function() {     x <- yaml::read_yaml(system.file(package="iSEEindex", "example.yaml"))     x$datasets }  initial_fun <- function() {     x <- yaml::read_yaml(system.file(package="iSEEindex", "example.yaml"))     x$initial }  app <- iSEEindex(bfc, dataset_fun, initial_fun)  if (interactive()) {   shiny::runApp(app, port = 1234) }

title: Implementing custom iSEEindex resources
text: iSEEindex imports data sets initial app configurations files. files represented Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) lists metadata returned functions supplied FUN.datasets FUN.initial arguments iSEEindex(). iSEEindex requires URI contain scheme component (Wikipedia ), identify type resource invoke associated method accessing . system allows iSEEindex users use standard custom schemes URI resources, fetch files virtually logical physical resource, local remote. vignette, describe implementation iSEEindex resources, using built-classes resources examples.

title: Implementing custom iSEEindex resources
text: Given scheme <scheme>, iSEEindex automatically attempts create object class iSEEindex<Scheme>Resource contains class iSEEindexResource. instance, scheme https produces object class iSEEindexHttpsResource. iSEEindex provides range built-iSEEindexResource sub-classes, described dedicated sections . raw value URI (including scheme component) always stored uri slot iSEEindexResource object. iSEEindexResource sub-class must define method precache(). first use, precache() processes raw value URI, downloads resource file locally using custom code necessary, caches file using BiocFileCache, returns path cached file. subsequent uses, BiocFileCache used fetch cached file directly.

title: Implementing custom iSEEindex resources
text: type resource documented help("iSEEindexHttpsResource-class").

title: Implementing custom iSEEindex resources
text: Briefly, class used represent files publicly accessible online HTTPS. URI must use standard scheme “https”, followed URI file internet. Example:
code: https://zenodo.org/record/7304331/files/ReprocessedAllenData.rds?download=1

title: Implementing custom iSEEindex resources
text: BiocFileCache package can handle HTTPS perfectly well. instance, precache() function job cache file located given URI using BiocFileCache.

title: Implementing custom iSEEindex resources
text: type resource documented help("iSEEindexLocalhostResource-class"). Briefly, class used represent files already present filesystem machine runs application. URI must use custom scheme “localhost”, followed path – absolute relative – file disk. Example:
code: localhost:///absolute/path/to/file localhost://relative/path/to/file

title: Implementing custom iSEEindex resources
text: Now, BiocFileCache package can perfectly well handle local files, know deal custom scheme localhost. instance, precache() function job remove localhost:// prefix URI, cache file located resulting file path using BiocFileCache.

title: Implementing custom iSEEindex resources
text: type resource documented help("iSEEindexRcallResource-class"). Briefly, class used represent files whose local file path obtained result executing R code. URI must use custom scheme “rcall”, followed R code execute. custom scheme created mainly dynamically fetch example files distributed installed package. Example:
code: rcall://system.file(package='iSEEindex','ReprocessedAllenData_config_01.R')

title: Implementing custom iSEEindex resources
text: custom scheme rcall entirely made purpose described ; way recognised standard scheme Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA). , BiocFileCache package possibly know handle custom scheme. instance, precache() function job remove rcall:// prefix URI, evaluate remainder URI R code, cache file located resulting file path using BiocFileCache.

title: Implementing custom iSEEindex resources
text: type resource documented help("iSEEindexS3Resource-class"). Briefly, class used represent files accessible Amazon S3. URI must use custom scheme “s3”, followed S3 URI file. Example:
code: s3://bucket/prefix/file

title: Implementing custom iSEEindex resources
text: Now, scheme s3 recognised AWS Command Line Interface, BiocFileCache package know deal . instance, precache() function job parse URI information passed paws.storage package download file, cached using BiocFileCache.

title: Implementing custom iSEEindex resources
text: type resource documented help("iSEEindexRunrResource-class"). class used represent directly objects generated via call arbitrary R code. URI must use custom scheme “runr”, followed code run obtain object explore. Example:
code: runr://function_to_call(param1 = "value1", param2 = "value2")

what: iSEE extension for a landing page to a custom collection of data sets
title: iSEE extension for a landing page to a custom collection of data sets
text: goal iSEEindex provide interface collection data sets, hosted anywhere, within single iSEE web-application. main functionality package define custom landing page iSEE web-applications app maintainers can list entirely custom collections data sets hosted virtually locally remotely accessible network. number built-methods implemented, providing access common types resources, e.g.: Local filesystem HTTPS URIs Amazon S3 buckets Arbitrary R code load objects directly type resource identified scheme component URI. Standard schemes can used alongside custom-made ones, e.g.: localhost:// local files. https:// files downloaded HTTPS protocol. s3:// files downloaded Amazon S3 buckets. runr:// load objects directly via call R code iSEEindex framework enables app maintainers independently define new methods choice standard custom-made URI schemes. information available vignette Implementing custom iSEEindex resources. resulting landing page presents end-users web-applications predefined choice data sets initial configuration states (specific data set). selecting data set – optionally – initial configuration, launching main app fetches resources respective URI caches using BiocFileCache package. Finally, data sets configurations loaded cache main iSEE application, interactive exploration.

title: iSEE extension for a landing page to a custom collection of data sets
text: Get latest stable R release CRAN. install iSEEindex Bioconductor using following code: development version GitHub :
code: if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE)) {     install.packages("BiocManager") }  BiocManager::install("iSEEindex") BiocManager::install("iSEE/iSEEindex")

title: iSEE extension for a landing page to a custom collection of data sets
text: basic example shows launch application lists publicly available data sets hosted zenodo.org:
code: library("iSEEindex") library("BiocFileCache")  bfc <- BiocFileCache(cache = tempdir())  dataset_fun <- function() {   x <- yaml::read_yaml(system.file(package = "iSEEindex", "example.yaml"))   x$datasets }  initial_fun <- function() {   x <- yaml::read_yaml(system.file(package = "iSEEindex", "example.yaml"))   x$initial }  app <- iSEEindex(bfc, dataset_fun, initial_fun)  if (interactive()) {     shiny::runApp(app, port = 1234) }

title: iSEEindex App — iSEEindex
code: iSEEindex(   bfc,   FUN.datasets,   FUN.initial = NULL,   default.add = TRUE,   default.position = c("first", "last"),   app.title = NULL,   body.header = NULL,   body.footer = NULL )

title: iSEEindex App — iSEEindex
text: bfc BiocFileCache() object. FUN.datasets function returns list metadata available data sets. FUN.initial function returns list metadata available initial configuration states. default.add Logical scalar indicating whether default initial configuration added choice Shiny selectizeInput(). See iSEEindex(). default.position Character scalar indicating whether default initial configuration added "first" "last" option Shiny selectizeInput(). app.title Character string specify desired title displayed main window dashboard. Defaults NULL, displays info versions iSEEindex iSEE packages. body.header UI element display main landing page body. body.footer UI element display main landing page body.

title: iSEEindex App — iSEEindex
text: iSEE::iSEE() app custom landing page using BiocFileCache() cache selection data sets.

title: iSEEindex App — iSEEindex
text: function passed argument FUN.datasets must return list contains metadata available data sets. data set, required metadata : id unique identifier data set. title short human-readable title data set, displayed 'Info' panel data set selected. uri Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) indicates location data file contains data set. description detailed description data set, displayed 'Info' panel data set selected. Example:   individual sub-lists may also contain optional named metadata specific individual iSEEindexResource classes (refer help page classes details). Important: id value used identify data set file BiocFileCache. Thus, recommend using dedicated BiocFileCache() app, using BiocFileCache(cache) argument specify -disk location (directory path) dedicated cache.
code: list(   list(     id = "dataset01",     title = "Dataset 01",     uri = "https://example.com/1.rds",     description = "My first data set."   ),   list(     id = "dataset02",     title = "Dataset 02",     uri = "https://example.com/1.rds",     description = "My second data set."   ) )

title: iSEEindex App — iSEEindex
text: function passed argument FUN.initial must return list contains metadata available initial configurations, NULL absence custom initial configuration (default settings applied data sets.). initial configuration, required metadata : id unique identifier initial configuration. title short human-readable title initial configuration, representing initial configuration 'Initial settings' dropdown menu. uri Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) indicates location R script contains initial configuration. description detailed description initial configuration, displayed 'Configure launch' panel initial configuration selected. initial configuration, optional metadata : datasets series data set identifiers configuration made available. missing, configuration available data sets. Example:   individual sub-lists may also contain additional optional named metadata specific individual iSEEindexResource classes (refer help page classes details).
code: list(   list(      id = "config01",      datasets = c("dataset01")      title = "Configuration 01",      uri = "https://example.com/1.R",      description = "My first configuration."   ),   list(      id = "config02",      title = "Configuration 02",      uri = "https://example.com/2.R",      description = "My second configuration."   ) )

title: iSEEindex App — iSEEindex
text: Kevin Rue-Albrecht

title: iSEEindex App — iSEEindex
code: library("BiocFileCache") #> Loading required package: dbplyr bfc <- BiocFileCache(cache = tempdir())  dataset_fun <- function() {     x <- yaml::read_yaml(system.file(package = "iSEEindex", "example.yaml"))     x$datasets }  initial_fun <- function() {     x <- yaml::read_yaml(system.file(package = "iSEEindex", "example.yaml"))     x$initial }  app <- iSEEindex(bfc, dataset_fun, initial_fun)  if (interactive()) {     shiny::runApp(app, port = 1234) }  ## Alternatively, with the example based on using runr calls  dataset_fun_tonsils <- function() {     x <- yaml::read_yaml(         system.file("tonsils_example", "tonsil_package.yml", package = "iSEEindex")     )     x$datasets } initial_fun_tonsils <- function() {     x <- yaml::read_yaml(         system.file("tonsils_example", "tonsil_package.yml", package = "iSEEindex")     )     x$initial }  library("shiny") header_tonsils <- fluidRow(   shinydashboard::box(     width = 12, collapsible = TRUE, collapsed = TRUE,     title = "How to explore the Tonsil Atlas datasets",     includeMarkdown(       system.file("tonsils_example", "header_tonsils.md", package = "iSEEindex")     )   ) ) footer_tonsils <- fluidRow(   shinydashboard::box(     width = 12,     includeMarkdown(       system.file("tonsils_example", "footer_tonsils.md", package = "iSEEindex")     )   ) )  app_tonsils <- iSEEindex(bfc,     dataset_fun_tonsils,     initial_fun_tonsils,     default.add = TRUE,     default.position = "last",     app.title = "iSEE loves the Tonsil Data Atlas",     body.header = header_tonsils,     body.footer = footer_tonsils)  if (interactive()) {     shiny::runApp(app_tonsils, port = 5678) }   ## This example shows that it is possible to mix different types of resources ## Some provide the path, some directly the object  dataset_fun_mix <- function() {     x <- yaml::read_yaml(         system.file("mixed_resources.yml", package = "iSEEindex")     )     x$datasets } initial_fun_mix <- function() {     x <- yaml::read_yaml(         system.file("mixed_resources.yml", package = "iSEEindex")     )     x$initial }  app_mixed <- iSEEindex(bfc,     dataset_fun_mix,     initial_fun_mix,     default.add = TRUE,     default.position = "last",     app.title = "iSEE loves multiple resource types")  if (interactive()) {     shiny::runApp(app_mixed, port = 4242) }

title: The iSEEindexHttpsResource class — iSEEindexHttpsResource-class
text: iSEEindexHttpsResource class represents resource accessible HTTPS link. URI type resource uses prefix “https://”.

text: x List metadata. See Details.

text: constructor function iSEEindexHttpsResource() returns object class iSEEindexHttpsResource.

title: The iSEEindexHttpsResource class — iSEEindexHttpsResource-class
text: Required metadata: uri Character scalar. URI resource.

title: The iSEEindexHttpsResource class — iSEEindexHttpsResource-class
text: class inherits slots parent class iSEEindexResource.

title: The iSEEindexHttpsResource class — iSEEindexHttpsResource-class
text: following code snippets, x instance iSEEindexHttpsResource class. Refer documentation method details remaining arguments. precache(x, bfc, id, ...) caches resource located given URI using BiocFileCache returns file path cached file.

text: Required metadata: uri Character scalar. URI resource.

title: The iSEEindexLocalhostResource class — iSEEindexLocalhostResource-class
text: class inherits slots parent class iSEEindexResource.

title: The iSEEindexLocalhostResource class — iSEEindexLocalhostResource-class
text: following code snippets, x instance iSEEindexLocalhostResource class. Refer documentation method details remaining arguments. precache(x, ...) trims localhost:// prefix, caches copy resource located resulting file path using BiocFileCache, returning file path cached file.

title: The iSEEindexLocalhostResource class — iSEEindexLocalhostResource-class
text: Absolute relative paths supported. Absolute paths require additional / (forward slash) following double forward slash // separating scheme component URI. instance: localhost://path//file refers relative path path//file (relative working directory Shiny application launched). localhost:///path//file refers absolute path /path//file.

title: The iSEEindexLocalhostResource class — iSEEindexLocalhostResource-class
text: Kevin Rue-Albrecht

title: The iSEEindexLocalhostResource class — iSEEindexLocalhostResource-class
code: iSEEindexLocalhostResource(list(uri = "localhost:///example/absolute/path")) #> class: iSEEindexLocalhostResource  #> - uri: localhost:///example/absolute/path  iSEEindexLocalhostResource(list(uri = "localhost://example/relative/path")) #> class: iSEEindexLocalhostResource  #> - uri: localhost://example/relative/path

title: The iSEEindexRcallResource class — iSEEindexRcallResource-class
text: URI must contain valid R code, prefix rcall:// removed. code must return path existing file local filesystem. instance:
code: rcall://system.file(package='iSEEindex','ReprocessedAllenData_config_01.R')

Refer documentation method details remaining arguments. precache(x, ...) trims rcall:// prefix, evaluates remainder URI R code, caches copy resource located resulting file path using BiocFileCache, returning file path cached file.

title: The iSEEindexS3Resource class — iSEEindexS3Resource-class
text: iSEEindexS3Resource class represents cloud storage resource accessible via paws.storage R package. URI type resource uses prefix “s3://”.

title: The iSEEindexS3Resource class — iSEEindexS3Resource-class
code: iSEEindexS3Resource(x)

title: The iSEEindexS3Resource class — iSEEindexS3Resource-class
text: x List metadata. See Details.

title: The iSEEindexS3Resource class — iSEEindexS3Resource-class
text: constructor function iSEEindexS3Resource() returns object object class iSEEindexS3Resource.

title: The iSEEindexS3Resource class — iSEEindexS3Resource-class
text: Required metadata: uri Character scalar. URI resource.

title: The iSEEindexS3Resource class — iSEEindexS3Resource-class
text: class inherits slots parent class iSEEindexResource. Furthermore, class defines additional slot(s) : region AWS region.

title: The iSEEindexS3Resource class — iSEEindexS3Resource-class
text: following code snippets, x instance iSEEindexS3Resource class. Refer documentation method details remaining arguments. precache(x, ..., temp_dir = tempdir()) trims s3:// prefix, parses information encoded remainder URI, downloads resource AWS S3 using information, caches copy resource located resulting file path using BiocFileCache, returning file path cached file.

title: The iSEEindexS3Resource class — iSEEindexS3Resource-class
text: URI must correspond existing file AWS S3 compatible cloud storage system. instance:   details authentication, see section “AWS Credentials” .
code: s3://bucket/prefix/index.rds

title: The iSEEindexS3Resource class — iSEEindexS3Resource-class
text: Additional arguments precache(x, ..., temp_dir = tempdir()): temp_dir Scalar character, directory store downloaded file handed BiocFileCache. directory created recursively already exist.

title: The iSEEindexS3Resource class — iSEEindexS3Resource-class
text: detailed information, please consult paws R package documentation. Currently, must AWS Command Line Interface installed use AWS SSO paws.storage. default AWS region can set file ~/.aws/config. instance:   Optionally, field named region can added list resource metadata set AWS S3 region individual resource, e.g.   Regions set individual resource metadata override default AWS region set ~/.aws/config (). region metadata need set resources use default region, resource classes require region information. default region set ~/.aws/config, region MUST set metadata. Credentials services can set AWS shared credentials file ~/.aws/credentials. instance:
code: [default] region=eu-west-2 - id: ID1   title: ReprocessedAllenData   uri: s3://example/ReprocessedAllenData.rds   description: |     Reprocessed Allen Data.   region: eu-west-2 [default] aws_access_key_id=your AWS access key aws_secret_access_key=your AWS secret key

title: The iSEEindexS3Resource class — iSEEindexS3Resource-class
text: Thomas Sandmann, Kevin Rue-Albrecht

title: The iSEEindexS3Resource class — iSEEindexS3Resource-class
code: # Without region metadata metadata <- list(uri = "s3://example/path/to/bucket") x <- iSEEindexS3Resource(metadata) str(x) #> Formal class 'iSEEindexS3Resource' [package "iSEEindex"] with 2 slots #>   ..@ region: chr NA #>   ..@ uri   : chr "s3://example/path/to/bucket"  # With region metadata # NOTE: The @region slot is set to NA pending bugfix (see above). metadata <- list(uri = "s3://example/path/to/bucket", region = "eu-west-2") x <- iSEEindexS3Resource(metadata) str(x) #> Formal class 'iSEEindexS3Resource' [package "iSEEindex"] with 2 slots #>   ..@ region: chr "eu-west-2" #>   ..@ uri   : chr "s3://example/path/to/bucket"

title: iSEEindex 1.3.2
text: Added full implementation runr resource class, defining behavior simple heuristics based fact users can now also provide just path call command R run (therefore, name runr) obtain object explore. typical use case deploy collection datasets data package.

title: iSEEindex 1.3.1
text: Version bump rebuild classes derived DotPlot.
